The release details were announced yesterday by Microsoft CEO Steve Ballmer . This launch marks the first time that a product has been provided as an online service before its conventional release, an act that, Steve Ballmer says, really reflects the push by Microsoft into the cloud. Microsoft previously focused primarily on the on-premises version of Dynamics CRM, putting the company at odds with major competitors such as Salesforce.com's CRM suite. And so was born` the special comment"-- his first one coming in August 2006, rebutting a speech that then-Defense Donald Rumsfeld had delivered to the American Legion. Said Keith Olbermann that night: The confusion we-- as its citizens-- must now address, is stark and forbidding. But variations of it have faced our forefathers, when men like Nixon and McCarthy and Curtis LeMay have darkened our skies and obscured our flag. . This was a brilliant stroke, but no follow-on troops were allocated to occupy those bypassed areas-and thus to preempt the insurgency that grew up as a result. "In retrospect," Donald Rumsfeld allows, it's possible there may have been times when more troops could have been helpful.... It is conceivable that several thousand more troops in Baghdad, where most of the media was located, might have at least kept the capital from appearing so chaotic, a perception that proved damaging throughout our country and the world( p. 664, italics added). of one sun god, Aton. The bust is at the top of a "wish list" of five major artefacts exhibited abroad that Egypt wants returned as part of its cultural heritage. Egypt recognises and appreciates the care and effort undertaken by the government of Germany to preserve and display the painted limestone bust of Queen Nefertiti, Zahi Hawass said in a statement. But he asked that "this unique treasure be returned to the possession of its rightful owners, the Egyptian people." Article: Egypt asks Berlin to return Nefertiti
